page.title: 14HOUSING.
page.content: The dominant type of housing within the area, Customs House Quay along the waterfront to the Bus Depot as far back as Wellington Park, is council housing. There are some private dwellings, old cottage bungalows, to be found in the Leven Road, Bawhirley Road, Kilmacolm Road, Belville Street and Auchmountain Road areas. The council housing, which is all rented accommodation is made up of high rise flats, tenement flats and maisonettes. In Belville Street, seven high rise blocks of flats are known as the Seven Sisters and their names come from Scottish Border Towns, Hawick, Jedburgh, Kelso, Langholm, Melrose Peebles and Selkirk. An interesting feature is the recent construction of a small housing complex, Carwood Court which is designed for the old and infirm.
